abstract: International Boxing Assn's decision to allow professional boxers to compete in Olympics in Rio has prompted many to voice their opposition, including doctors and former professional boxers, who say it is dangerous and bad for sport; AIBA's president Chin-Kuo Wu says decision will be beneficial for sport, and will lead to creation of umbrella group to bring order to way it is organized across globe.
lead_paragraph: Pro boxers are competing at the Games for the first time, but the decision to allow them triggered an immediate backlash from some doctors, boxers and promoters.
snippet: Pro boxers are competing at the Games for the first time, but the decision to allow them triggered an immediate backlash from some doctors, boxers and promoters....

headline.main: Pro Boxers at the Olympics: An Opportunity, or a Dangerous Power Grab?
headline.print_headline: A Fight as Pro Boxers Enter the Games
